ComicInfo.Summary:
Parody of a Red Lobster ad, featuring all the sea food ruined by oil.
Parody of a game, featuring the backstory, characters, rules, and equipment.
A collection of comic strips.
Fake coupons parodying a typical book of entertainment, restaurant, and lodging coupons, detailing why you never use them.
In the first story, the White Spy if foiled by a Rube Goldberg type device of the Black Spy. In the second story, the White Spy blows up the Black Spy with a rocket hidden under a rock.
Stills from the movie "Harry Potter And The Deathly Hallows" with fake dialog.
Goofy results of being a fashion fanatic.
All the worst roommate bad habits taken to extremes.
Tea party thoughts taken to extremes.
Things to avoid if you're begging.
Parody of Rosetta Stone ad featuring Mel Gibson swearing.
Unexpected consequences of the Gulf of Mexico oil spill, including the apparent death of Aquaman.
A parody of a typical episode of Glee, with running commentary from Simon Cowell and others.
Various short satires of pop culture.

ComicInfo.Title: Dead Lobster; The MAD Vault 1978; MAD's Handy Quick Primer To World of Warcraft; The Strip Club; The 2010 Lack-Of-Entertainment Book; Spy Vs. Spy; MAD's Less-Than-Magical Outtakes From Harry Potter And The Deathly Hallows; The MAD World of...Fashion; Signs You've Got A Bad Roommate; Tea Party Logic; A Beginner's Guide To A More Prosperous Career In Panhandling; The Fastest Way To Learn A Language; A MAD Look At The Oil Spill; Glee-Tarded; The Fundalini Pages
